channel.title: Help Making Server Online Non-Hamachi
channel.description:
So I've been trying to figure out how to make my server public without having to use Hamachi. I've ran private servers for WoW so I know how to use either No-IP and DynDns and I've also portforwarded.
I've added a host and I've downloaded No-IP but when I try to connect to my server, it gets stuck at, "Connecting to Update Server" and my CMD says "error_game_js5connect".
So I tried going to my "Host" file in my drivers folder and I added this under everything.
127.0.0.1 *server name* 192.168.1.## *server name* *External IP* *server name*
and I was able to connect but when I looked at my CMD, I only connected through 127.0.0.1 and 192.168.1.## and not my external IP. So then I tried just putting in my external IP and I couldn't connect.
When I worked on WoW private servers, I have to change the IP in the txt files, but I can't find anywhere to change it in the .java files in my source or client.
Any help??

item.title: Help Making Server Online Non-Hamachi
item.dc:creator: @dqtreats dqtreats
item.description:
@dqtreats wrote:

[quote=“iz3 legend, post:2, topic:395914”]you have to connect to 127.0.0.1 others connect using your no-ip

so in the client you connect with the ip would be 127.0.0.1
but for others to conenct it has to be the ip you made.[/quote]

They can’t connect either.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Making Server Online Non-Hamachi
item.dc:creator: @dqtreats dqtreats
item.description:
@dqtreats wrote:

So I’ve been trying to figure out how to make my server public without having to use Hamachi. I’ve ran private servers for WoW so I know how to use either No-IP and DynDns and I’ve also portforwarded.

I’ve added a host and I’ve downloaded No-IP but when I try to connect to my server, it gets stuck at, “Connecting to Update Server” and my CMD says “error_game_js5connect”.

So I tried going to my “Host” file in my drivers folder and I added this under everything.

127.0.0.1 server name
192.168.1.## server name
External IP server name

and I was able to connect but when I looked at my CMD, I only connected through 127.0.0.1 and 192.168.1.## and not my external IP. So then I tried just putting in my external IP and I couldn’t connect.

When I worked on WoW private servers, I have to change the IP in the txt files, but I can’t find anywhere to change it in the .java files in my source or client.

Any help??

Read full topic
